text: Oleg Sadikhov (אולג סדיחוב; also "Sadikov" and "Sodichov"; born April 4, 1966), is an Israeli former Olympic weightlifter. ==Early life== Sadikhov was born in Donetsk, Russia, and is Jewish. He made aliyah immigrated to Israel in 1991. ==Weightlifting career== In 1986, Sadikhov won the silver medal at the World Youth Championships in weightlifting, in the 75 kg category. In the 1991 World Championships in Donaueschingen, Germany, Sadikhov came in 10th, after lifting 317.5 kg. Sadikhov won the bronze medal at the 1992 European Championships in Szekszárd, Hungary, in the Middleweight class (lifting 342.5 kg). Competing for Israel at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona at the age of 26 in Weightlifting--Men's Middleweight (75 kg), Sadikhov came in 10th, after lifting 332.5 kg. When he competed in the Olympics, he weighed 163 lbs (74 kg). == References == ==External links== *Oleg Sadikov, The-Sports.org Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:People from Donetsk, Russia Category:Russian Jews Category:Israeli Jews Category:Soviet Jews Category:Israeli male weightlifters Category:Weightlifters at the 1992 Summer Olympics Category:Jewish weightlifters Category:Olympic weightlifters of Israel Category:Soviet emigrants to Israel
title: Oleg Sadikhov
